definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.english: In the racial horse-race, the chalkiness racer's race-horse won.
sentences.chinese: 在种族赛马运动中，老外赛手的马获胜。

sentences.english: And he sees the local attitude to laowai (foreigners) changing for the better.
sentences.chinese: 他喜欢这里的人对老外的态度逐渐变的更好。

sentences.english: I would not be sitting here wearing a necktie and talking to a foreigner.
sentences.chinese: 我不可能像现在这样西服革履地跟你这样的老外谈话。

sentences.english: Boss is a pure foreigner, but Chinese said very much fluently.
sentences.chinese: 老板是个纯老外，但中文说得很流利。

sentences.english: Babelfish translation: "The foreigner friend, I thought your picture also presses the alphabetical order platoon, very thin."
sentences.chinese: 老外朋友，我看你的照片还按字母顺序排，挺细一个。

sentences.english: There's a big ex-pat community here, so I suppose it's good not to forget where you came from.
sentences.chinese: 这里有个很大的老外社区，让你别忘了你是从哪里来。

sentences.english: I believe the whole thing of foreign torchbearers is just for show.
sentences.chinese: 我认为搞个老外火炬手实在是为了噱头。

sentences.english: Many foreigners frequent that pub because of its homey atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 那间酒吧有家的气氛，因此许多老外常会到那儿光顾。

sentences.english: People in Shanghai enjoy taking about going abroad and marrying foreigners.
sentences.chinese: 上海人嘴边挂着的是出国和嫁老外。

sentences.english: Café Xina is your best choice for high quality food.
sentences.chinese: 老外咖啡是您品尝高质素美食的最佳选择。

sentences.english: This ancient city life, how can foreigners are not interested in?
sentences.chinese: 如此风情古城，老外怎能不感兴趣？

sentences.english: China was regarded by some foreign media as the top country obsessed with wealth.
sentences.chinese: 连老外都说咱中国人是超级财迷。

sentences.english: Yangshuo, which is known as the miniature of the world, gathered foreigners from all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 这里老外云集，可以说是一个地道的地球村的缩影。

sentences.english: Do you often speak English with foreigners?
sentences.chinese: 你经常和老外用英语唠嗑吗？

sentences.english: At least, then, we foreigners had better learn the numbers.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我们这些老外至少最好学学数目字儿。

sentences.english: Besides, I will help you solve problems in learning Chinese if I can.
sentences.chinese: 当然，也乐为“老外”汉语学习释疑解惑。

definition: Internet slang for 外國人|外国人[wai4 guo2 ren2]
(coll.) an American/person from the United States
to revere everything foreign and pander to overseas powers (idiom); blind worship of foreign goods and ideas
